verses.verse: And it came<WH1961> to pass in those<WH1992> days,<WH3117> when there was no<WH369> king<WH4428> in Israel,<WH3478> that there was a certain<WH376> Levite<WH3881> sojourning<WH1481> on the side<WH3411> of mount<WH2022> Ephraim,<WH669> who took<WH3947> to him a concubine<WH6370> out of Bethlehemjudah.<WH1035>

And his concubine<WH6370> played the whore<WH2181> against<WH5921> him, and went<WH3212> away from him to her father's<WH1> house<WH1004> to Bethlehemjudah,<WH1035> and was there<WH8033> four<WH702> whole<WH3117> months.<WH2320>

And her husband<WH376> arose,<WH6965> and went<WH3212> after<WH310> her, to speak<WH1696> friendly<WH3820> to her, and to bring<WH7725> her again,<WH7725> having his servant<WH5288> with him, and a couple<WH6776> of asses:<WH2543> and she brought<WH935> him into her father's<WH1> house:<WH1004> and when the father<WH1> of the damsel<WH5291> saw<WH7200> him, he rejoiced<WH8055> to meet<WH7125> him.

And his father<WH2859> in law,<WH2859> the damsel's<WH5291> father,<WH1> retained<WH2388> him; and he stayed<WH3427> with him three<WH7969> days:<WH3117> so they did eat<WH398> and drink,<WH8354> and lodged<WH3885> there.<WH8033>

And it came<WH1961> to pass on the fourth<WH7243> day,<WH3117> when they arose<WH7925> early<WH7925> in the morning,<WH1242> that he rose<WH6965> up to depart:<WH3212> and the damsel's<WH5291> father<WH1> said<WH559> to his son<WH2860> in law,<WH2859> Comfort<WH5582> your heart<WH3820> with a morsel<WH6595> of bread,<WH3899> and afterward<WH310> go<WH3212> your way.

And they sat<WH3427> down, and did eat<WH398> and drink<WH8354> both<WH8147> of them together:<WH3162> for the damsel's<WH5291> father<WH1> had said<WH559> to the man,<WH376> Be content,<WH2974> I pray<WH4994> you, and tarry<WH3885> all<WH3885> night, and let your heart<WH3820> be merry.<WH3190>
And when the man<WH376> rose<WH6965> up to depart,<WH3212> his father<WH2859> in law<WH2859> urged<WH6484> him: therefore he lodged<WH3885> there<WH8033> again.<WH7725>

And he arose<WH7925> early<WH7925> in the morning<WH1242> on the fifth<WH2549> day<WH3117> to depart;<WH3212> and the damsel's<WH5291> father<WH1> said,<WH559> Comfort<WH5582> your heart,<WH3824> I pray<WH4994> you. And they tarried<WH4102> until<WH5704> afternoon,<WH5186> <WH3117> and they did eat<WH398> both<WH8147> of them.

And when the man<WH376> rose<WH6965> up to depart,<WH3212> he, and his concubine,<WH6370> and his servant,<WH5288> his father<WH2859> in law,<WH2859> the damsel's<WH5291> father,<WH1> said<WH559> to him, Behold,<WH2009> now<WH4994> the day<WH3117> draws<WH7503> toward evening,<WH6150> I pray<WH4994> you tarry<WH3885> all<WH3885> night: behold,<WH2009> the day<WH3117> grows<WH2583> to an end,<WH2583> lodge<WH3885> here,<WH6311> that your heart<WH3824> may be merry;<WH3190> and to morrow<WH4279> get you early<WH7925> on your way,<WH1870> that you may go<WH1980> home.<WH168>

But the man<WH376> would<WH14> not tarry<WH3885> that night, but he rose<WH6965> up and departed,<WH3212> and came<WH935> over<WH5227> against<WH5227> Jebus,<WH2982> which<WH1958> is Jerusalem;<WH3389> and there were with him two<WH6776> asses<WH2543> saddled,<WH2280> his concubine<WH6370> also was with him.

And when they were by Jebus,<WH2982> the day<WH3117> was far<WH3966> spent;<WH7286> and the servant<WH5288> said<WH559> to his master,<WH113> Come,<WH3212> I pray<WH4994> you, and let us turn<WH5493> in into<WH413> this<WH2063> city<WH5892> of the Jebusites,<WH2983> and lodge<WH3885> in it.

And his master<WH113> said<WH559> to him, We will not turn<WH5493> aside here into<WH413> the city<WH5892> of a stranger,<WH5237> that is not of the children<WH1121> of Israel;<WH3478> we will pass<WH5674> over<WH5674> to Gibeah.<WH1390>

And he said<WH559> to his servant,<WH5288> Come,<WH3212> and let us draw near<WH7126> to one<WH259> of these places<WH4725> to lodge<WH3885> all<WH3885> night, in Gibeah,<WH1390> or<WH176> in Ramah.<WH7414>
And they passed<WH5674> on and went<WH3212> their way;<WH3212> and the sun<WH8121> went<WH935> down on them when they were by Gibeah,<WH1390> which<WH834> belongs to Benjamin.<WH1144>

And they turned<WH5493> aside thither,<WH8033> to go<WH935> in and to lodge<WH3885> in Gibeah:<WH1390> and when he went<WH935> in, he sat<WH3427> him down in a street<WH7339> of the city:<WH5892> for there was no<WH369> man<WH376> that took<WH622> them into his house<WH1004> to lodging.<WH3885>

And, behold,<WH2009> there came<WH935> an old<WH2205> man<WH376> from his work<WH4639> out of the field<WH7704> at even,<WH6153> which was also of mount<WH2022> Ephraim;<WH669> and he sojourned<WH1481> in Gibeah:<WH1390> but the men<WH582> of the place<WH4725> were Benjamites.<WH1145>

And when he had lifted<WH5375> up his eyes,<WH5869> he saw<WH7200> a wayfaring<WH732> man<WH376> in the street<WH7339> of the city:<WH5892> and the old<WH2205> man<WH376> said,<WH559> Where<WH575> go<WH3212> you? and from where<WH370> come<WH935> you?

And he said<WH559> to him, We are passing<WH5674> from Bethlehemjudah<WH1035> toward<WH5704> the side<WH3411> of mount<WH2022> Ephraim;<WH669> from there<WH8033> am I: and I went<WH3212> to Bethlehemjudah,<WH1035> but I am now going<WH1980> to the house<WH1004> of the LORD;<WH3068> and there is no<WH369> man<WH376> that receives<WH622> me to house.<WH1004>

Yet<WH1571> there is both<WH1571> straw<WH8401> and provender<WH4554> for our asses;<WH2543> and there is bread<WH3899> and wine<WH3196> also<WH1571> for me, and for your handmaid,<WH519> and for the young<WH5288> man which is with your servants:<WH5650> there is no<WH369> want<WH4270> of any<WH3605> thing.<WH1697>
And the old<WH2205> man<WH376> said,<WH559> Peace<WH7965> be with you; howsoever<WH7535> let all<WH3605> your wants<WH4270> lie on me; only<WH7535> lodge<WH3885> not in the street.<WH7339>
So he brought<WH935> him into his house,<WH1004> and gave provender<WH1101> to the asses:<WH2543> and they washed<WH7364> their feet,<WH7272> and did eat<WH398> and drink.<WH8354>

Now as they were making their hearts<WH3820> merry,<WH3190> behold,<WH2009> the men<WH582> of the city,<WH5892> certain<WH582> sons<WH1121> of Belial,<WH1100> beset<WH5437> the house<WH1004> round<WH5437> about, and beat<WH1849> at<WH5921> the door,<WH1817> and spoke<WH559> to the master<WH1167> of the house,<WH1004> the old<WH2205> man,<WH376> saying,<WH559> Bring<WH3318> forth<WH3318> the man<WH376> that came<WH935> into<WH413> your house,<WH1004> that we may know<WH3045> him.

And the man,<WH376> the master<WH1167> of the house,<WH1004> went<WH3318> out to them, and said<WH559> to them, No,<WH408> my brothers,<WH251> no, I pray<WH4994> you, do not so wickedly;<WH7489> seeing<WH310> that this<WH2088> man<WH376> is come<WH935> into<WH413> my house,<WH1004> do<WH6213> not this<WH2063> folly.<WH5039>

Behold,<WH2009> here is my daughter<WH1323> a maiden,<WH1330> and his concubine;<WH6370> them I will bring<WH3318> out now,<WH4994> and humble<WH6031> you them, and do<WH6213> with them what seems<WH5869> good<WH2896> to you: but to this<WH2088> man<WH376> do<WH6213> not so<WH2063> vile<WH5039> a thing.<WH1697>

But the men<WH582> would<WH14> not listen<WH8085> to him: so the man<WH376> took<WH2388> his concubine,<WH6370> and brought<WH3318> her forth<WH3318> to them; and they knew<WH3045> her, and abused<WH5953> her all<WH3605> the night<WH3915> until<WH5704> the morning:<WH1242> and when the day<WH7837> began to spring,<WH5927> they let her go.<WH7971>

Then came<WH935> the woman<WH802> in the dawning<WH6437> of the day,<WH1242> and fell<WH5307> down at the door<WH6607> of the man's<WH376> house<WH1004> where<WH834> <WH8033> her lord<WH113> was, till<WH5704> it was light.<WH216>

And her lord<WH113> rose<WH6965> up in the morning,<WH1242> and opened<WH6605> the doors<WH1817> of the house,<WH1004> and went<WH3318> out to go<WH3212> his way:<WH1870> and, behold,<WH2009> the woman<WH802> his concubine<WH6370> was fallen<WH5307> down at the door<WH6607> of the house,<WH1004> and her hands<WH3027> were on the threshold.<WH5592>

And he said<WH559> to her, Up, and let us be going.<WH3212> But none<WH369> answered.<WH6030> Then the man<WH376> took<WH3947> her up on an ass,<WH2543> and the man<WH376> rose<WH6965> up, and got<WH3212> him to his place.<WH4725>

And when he was come<WH935> into<WH413> his house,<WH1004> he took<WH3947> a knife,<WH3979> and laid hold<WH2388> on his concubine,<WH6370> and divided<WH5408> her, together with her bones,<WH6106> into twelve<WH8147> <WH6240> pieces,<WH5409> and sent<WH7971> her into all<WH3605> the coasts<WH1366> of Israel.<WH3478>

And it was so, that all<WH3605> that saw<WH7200> it said,<WH559> There was no<WH3808> such<WH2063> deed done<WH1961> nor<WH3808> seen<WH7200> from the day<WH3117> that the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> came<WH5927> up out of the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714> to this<WH2088> day:<WH3117> consider<WH7760> of it, take advice,<WH5779> and speak<WH1696> your minds.
